questions.question: Q1. Which of the following materials can be formed using the orbital forming process?

explanations.a: Brass can be formed using orbital forming.
explanations.b: Aluminium can be formed using orbital forming.
explanations.c: Steel can also be formed using orbital forming.
explanations.d: Correct. Orbital forming works on many materials including brass, aluminium, and steel.

questions.question: Q2. Which of the following are advantages of the orbital forming process?

explanations.a: Correct advantage but not the only one.
explanations.b: Correct advantage but not the only one.
explanations.c: Correct advantage but not the only one.
explanations.d: Correct advantage but not the only one.
explanations.e: Correct. All listed points are advantages of orbital forming.

questions.question: Q3. Which of the following operations can be performed using the orbital forming process?

explanations.d: Correct. All listed operations can be done by orbital forming.

questions.question: Q4. Orbital forming is also known as:

explanations.a: Rotary forming is another name for orbital forming.
explanations.b: Swing forming is also used as a term for orbital forming.
explanations.c: Rocking-die forging is another technical name for orbital forming.
explanations.d: Correct. All names refer to the same process.

questions.question: Q5. Which of the following products is NOT made using the orbital forming process?

explanations.a: Fasteners can be made by orbital forming.
explanations.b: Bevel gears are NOT made by orbital forming â€” correct answer.
explanations.c: Wheels can be made with orbital forming.
explanations.d: Tubes can be formed in orbital forming.
